snippet: J. Robert Port, investigations editor of The Times Union of Albany, said the prostitution arrest of a massage therapist at the spa was retaliation.
abstract: J Robert Port, investigations editor of The Times Union of Albany, claims that the prostitution arrest of a massage therapist at a spa owned by his wife, Bin Cheng, is in retaliation for critical press coverage of the city's mayor and local law enforcement agencies.

headline.main: After Arrest at Spa Owned by His Wife, Albany Journalist Alleges Police Retaliation
headline.print_headline: After Arrest at Spa Owned by His Wife, Albany Journalist Alleges Police Retaliation

byline.original: By DANNY HAKIM and NICHOLAS CONFESSORE

snippet: The artwork-collection app artCircles belongs on every art lover's iPad, but owners of the third-generation tablet can have even more fun with the app than others.
abstract: The artwork-collection app artCircles belongs on every art lover's iPad, but owners of the third-generation tablet can have even more fun with the app than others.

snippet: A selected guide to rock, pop, hip-hop, punk, metal and music festivals in New York and the area.
The justices split over whether the constitutional protection against double jeopardy barred such reprosecutions.
abstract: Supreme Court rules that a criminal defendant may be retried even though the jury in his first trial had unanimously rejected the most serious charges against him; court votes 6 to 3, with justices split over whether the constitutional protection against double jeopardy bars such reprosecutions.

headline.main: Justices Allow Retrial on Rejected Charges
headline.print_headline: Justices Allow Retrial On Rejected Charges

snippet: The new application, called Facebook Camera, is intended to make it easier to take pictures and share them on Facebook.
abstract: The new application, called Facebook Camera, is intended to make it easier to take pictures and share them on Facebook.

headline.main: Facebook Releases a Photocentric App for Apple Devices

snippet: All the smart kids are selling their old gadgets. Here is how to get the highest price for those electronic goodies sitting neglected in drawers.
abstract: More than 278 million mobile devices lie idle or deactivated in the United States, and nearly half are smartphones; guide highlights how to resell them for the highest price.

headline.main: A Second Chance for Idle Electronics
headline.print_headline: A Second Chance for Idle Electronics

snippet: Apps like BuddyTV Guide, Peel and TV Guide let viewers find shows they want to watch more efficiently than by channel surfing.
abstract: Bob Tedeschi App Smart column notes apps like BuddyTV Guide, Peel and TV Guide let viewers find shows they want to watch more efficiently than by channel surfing.

headline.main: Seeing What’s on TV Without Touching the Remote
headline.print_headline: Seeing Whatâ€™s on TV Without Touching the Remote

snippet: As sales of tailored clothing increase, demand grows for a less structured suit that is actually fun to wear.
abstract: Many fashion designers, responding to a growing demand for men's tailored clothing, are introducing revamped, dressed-up and stripped-down summer suits that can be mixed and matched and actually fun to wear.

headline.main: For Men, a New Look for the Summer Suit

snippet: Finding it hard to keep up with radical shifts to new modes of computing, the technology company reported sharply lower net income and confirmed a plan to pare its work force.
abstract: Hewlett-Packard is finding it hard to keep up with radical shifts to new modes of computing; will layoff 27,000 employees, or 7.7 percent of its global work force of 349,600; reports fiscal second-quarter profit of $1.59 billion, or 80 cents a share, down 31 percent from $2.3 billion, or $1.05, in the year-ago quarter; revenue fell 3 percent to $30.69 billion.

headline.main: As Computing Changes, Hewlett-Packard Struggles to Follow
headline.print_headline: As Computing Changes, H.P. Struggles to Follow
